title: Synthetic Recap
body:
INDIANAPOLIS — On a night defined by one man’s singular will, the Miami Heat advanced not with a team, but with a force of nature named Tim Hardaway.

In a hostile Eastern Conference First Round clincher against the Indiana Pacers, Hardaway authored a performance for the ages, pouring in a staggering 41 points to single-handedly dismantle Indiana, 92-78. The veteran point guard didn't just lead his team; he carried it on his back, transforming a pivotal Game 5 into his personal masterpiece.

From the opening tip, Hardaway was unrelenting. His signature crossover left defenders grasping at air, and his shooting range seemed limitless. Every time the Pacers threatened to build momentum, Hardaway had an answer—a silky pull-up jumper from the elbow, a deep three-pointer in a defender’s eye, or a fearless drive into the heart of the defense. He was the engine, the scorer, and the closer all in one.

While the Pacers’ Reggie Miller fought hard for his 24 points, he was merely a spectator in the Tim Hardaway Show. The Heat’s defense, energized by their leader’s historic offensive outburst, clamped down, holding the Pacers to a paltry 78 points and snuffing out any hope of a comeback.

When the final buzzer sounded, the scorebook told the story: 41 points for Hardaway, a playoff career-high, and a ticket to the next round for the Heat. In the crucible of a winner-take-all playoff game, greatness is demanded. Tim Hardaway didn’t just meet that demand; he shattered it, delivering a performance that will forever be etched in Miami Heat playoff lore.
